page.title: 02Commerce in Bridlington
page.content: The holiday trade is very important with the shops geared to the day tripper and long-stay tourist; cafes gift shops and small, family, businesses are popular. The Railway station links the town with Hull and Scarborough and there are good bus and coach services. The town relies heavily upon the tourist trade with emphasis on the service sector. There is a small industrial estate at Bessingby where a number of local firms are situated. A{new hospital}is being built which will replace the current Lloyd Hospital. A new leisure centre is being built on the site of the old "3B's"theatre. A small shopping arcade has been built and there are several large supermarkets. There are plans to extend the provision of amusements along the sea front, fun fair etc.
